1. McCune-Albright syndrome: characterized by the triad of polyostotic fibrous dysplasia, cafe-au-lait skin pigmentation, and precocious puberty (seen in this patient). 4. Ollier disease: another disorder involving fibrous dysplasia that can be polyostotic. Does not typically involve skin pigmentation changes or endocrine dysfunction.

5. Fibrous dysplasia - endocrine dysfunction syndrome: a variant of McCune-Albright with fibrous dysplasia and endocrine issues but lacking cafe-au-lait spots. Possible but less likely given the skin findings in this patient.
